column4: output of the ﻿dpkg --configure -a command? nothing goes back to user@computer:~$ is dpkg one of the commands that has to be run without sudo?
Richard M Stallman here, at your service
open for suggestions
a dpkg -l command does not require sudo... however, a command like  dpkg --configure - a  ...does
what is the output of   sudo dpkg --configure -a  ...?
sudo dpkg --configure -a returned nothing just went back to user@computer:~$  and raylu: one sec will run again
yes..do,   apt-get -f install
you have to learn to use a 'pastebin'
nothing wrong with your system that i can see.. neither dpkg nor apt-get is complaining

i was reading it the same, yet add/remove programs gives me the same error code after 3 methods i've tried to fix broken packages and i went through the whole of all available applications so it really sux that its giving me this error as my eyes went bugy going through it all :)
so, it's all now? update-manager isn't complainin either, correct?
nope just finished update manager before i went to add/remove programs
ok, good! :-)

went to applications menu > add/remove... selected all available applications from drop down menu... went through everything to check the apps i wanted for installation and it gave me the error ﻿Could not apply changes! fix broken packages first. did synaptic > edit > fix broken packages hit retry in add/remove, same error... did sudo apt-get install -f in terminal as well as sudo dpkg --configure -a... retry
perhaps i misunderstood, is it still giving you trouble?
yes still giving problems, and wow that was interesting, my first netsplit :D
perhaps you should learn to use 'aptitude' to start off with
i really like the convenience of gui for mass installs
yes..
and i hear you about the gui being very nice for mass installs. it nice because you get a great view of it all
ok, raylu hit me with cluebat.. apt-get is the back end to synaptic. but dpkg handles the actuall install and uninstalling of individual packages
and add/remove is a "prettier" gui for synaptic application install/removal
